topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 : Deployment Overview

body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 is a carrier-grade distribution of OpenStack, the leading open source cloud computing platform.
HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade provides communications service providers (CSPs) with an open source based cloud platform that meets their demanding reliability requirements.
body.section:
Installing HPE OpenStack Carrier GradeThis section describes the process for installing HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0.
Before you perform the installation of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0, please read the following important information about the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation.
(READ THIS FIRST)
This document describes various deployment options available with Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0.
Irrespective of any deployment option that you select, you need to apply a branding tarball for installing the cloud. For more information, refer to the cloud installation section.

Administrator Guides These are addressed to HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade administrators responsible for the following areas:
Creating and maintaining resources used by end users (tenants), such as virtual machines, storage pools, network objects, and access credentials.
Operating and maintaining components of the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade product, such as clusters, nodes, system software, licensing files, and backup and restore facilities
The Administer Guide also contains specific tasks, such as logging, backup/restore, switch configuration, and configuring a multiple data center environment.
Operations Guide
The Operations Guide or the user guide introduces the Horizon interface with specific information on how to use Horizon to operate HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade on a day-to-day basis. API and SDK Reference
The API and SDK reference provides links to supported API and custom OpenStack API extensions. The page also links to the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Development Kit (SDK) documentation.
